TopicTitle: Anybody have any idea what version of Unity KSP is currently using?

Articles.Content:
Hey guys.

I've decided to do some... investigative work. I'd be keeping it top secret, except I've hit a snag.

I'm looking at that messy x64 prototype player again ![:rolleyes:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_rolleyes.gif)

*"What?! You mad or sumfin'?!" -- KSP Forum, probably.*

Perhaps I am mad, what of it? Back to my question then. As far as I'm aware, it's at least 4.3.3, and I know we haven't upgraded to 5 yet, but there have been quite a few updates in between the two and I've got no idea which one we're on. Logic would dictate one of the latest versions of Unity 4, but one can't be so sure (it can't actually be the latest version as it was only released after 1.0 landed/lifted off).

The[original x64 thread](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/82118-KSP-64bits-on-Windows-%28this-time-it-s-not-a-request%29) says 4.3.3, but that was for version 0.23.5. The player for 4.3.3 doesn't seem to be cooperative in that it won't even start the game, hence my thinking it's probably some newer version that I'll be needing.

I understand that I'm meddling with powers that I really shouldn't be here (even though it's just the replacement of two files...) and that the x64 version was vilified by many here owing to its bugginess, but I had very little problem with it on the whole (compared to what I've heard it *was* capable of) and I just want to see how it performs with 1.0.

Thanks ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

*"He's bonkers, I'm tellin' ya!" -- KSP Forum AND dev team, most likely.*

P.S. 1.0 is pretty damn cool. I'm loving the female Kerbals (at last!), though I've not done much except fret about the dismal vacuum ISP of the RAPIER and how my beloved Ranger SSTOs no longer work because of it. I'll think of something to get 'em working again, especially considering I need them working for a mission I've got planned. As my Rangers were inspired by those from *Interstellar*, I think a quote from the same film will suffice here: *"We'll find a way, professor, we always have."*

0.90 was on 4.5.5, I haven't checked what Unity version 1.0 shipped on, it could be 4.6.4?

The ksp.exe has the Unity version embedded in it though, just right-click>properties and look at the version number in the details tab

It's 4.6.4f1 ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

It says it in the player.log on Linux and OS X, and in the output\_log on Windows.
Ah, excellent. Thanks, guys, I'll post my findings later ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
